mobs.long_desc: A wild barbarian berserker guard stands before the doors.
mobs.desc: This barbarian is a giant beast of a man, primed to slay at a moment's notice. Years of experience and countless ravaging battles have earned him a place of honor guarding the Great Lodge.  It is his duty to keep out any who might accidentally enter the guildhall - for their own safety.

mobs.long_desc: Guildmaster Avaldr Mountainhelm oversees the chaos of the Great Lodge.
mobs.desc: Avaldr Mountainhelm is not quite what you would expect from the guildmaster of the berserker's guild.  His appearance is wild and rough, but he is well groomed, his long hair and beard restrained if not cleaned.  He wears the rough furs common of northern berserker barbarians, but with a little more discernment than one might expect.  He is also not the hulking beast most of his barbarian brethren are.  His tightly muscled body belies a speed and strength more deadly than his appearance suggests.

mobs.short_desc: A mysterious ranger from the north
mobs.long_desc: A cloaked ranger leans on a snow drift.
mobs.desc: A tall, slender elf is trying to adjust his snowshoes for the fresh powder. His clothes are made of the finest fur.  The white garments blend so well with the surrounding landscape that it is amazing he is visible at all.  Even the great longbow resting over his shoulder is wrapped in the excellent material. Steadily he adjusts his gear and garments for the open tundra.

triggers.name: Guard Ice Cult
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 if %actor.level% < 40 whisper %actor.name% You are much too weak to venture through this tunnel. wait 1 whisper %actor.name% Try other areas first. nudge %actor.name% else return 0 endif else return 0 endif

rooms.name: East of Ickle
rooms.description: You are standing just east of the East Gate of Ickle.  The trail to Mt. Frostbite begins just north of here.

North.description: You see the trail to Mt. Frostbite.

West.description: You see the outside of the Eastern Gate of Ickle.

rooms.name: Trail to Mt. FrostBite
rooms.description: You are standing on the trail to Mt. Frostbite.  The trail continues on to the north and south.

North.description: You see the trail to Mt. FrostBite!

South.description: You see the trail to Ickle.

rooms.name: Trail to Mt. FrostBite
rooms.description: You are standing on the trail to Mt. Frostbite.  The trail continues on to the north and south.

North.description: You see the trail to Mt. FrostBite!

South.description: You see the trail to Ickle.

rooms.name: Trail to Mt. FrostBite
rooms.description: You are standing on the trail to Mt. Frostbite.  The trail continues on to the north and south.

North.description: You see the trail to Mt. FrostBite!

South.description: You see the trail to Ickle.

rooms.name: Trail to Mt. FrostBite
rooms.description: You are standing on the trail to Mt. Frostbite.  The trail continues on to the east and south.

East.description: You see the trail to Mt. FrostBite!

South.description: You see the trail to Ickle.

rooms.name: Trail to Mt. FrostBite
rooms.description: You are standing on the trail to Mt. Frostbite.  The trail continues on to the east and west.

East.description: You see the trail to Mt. FrostBite!

West.description: You see the trail to Ickle.

rooms.name: Trail to Mt. FrostBite
rooms.description: You are standing on the trail to Mt. Frostbite.  The trail continues on to the north and west.

North.description: You see the trail to Mt. FrostBite!

West.description: You see the trail to Ickle.

rooms.name: Trail to Mt. FrostBite
rooms.description: You are standing on the trail to Mt. Frostbite.  The trail continues on to the north and south.

North.description: You see the trail to Mt. FrostBite!

South.description: You see the trail to Ickle.

rooms.name: Trail to Mt. FrostBite
rooms.description: You are standing on the trail to Mt. Frostbite.  The trail continues on to the north and south.

North.description: You see the trail to Mt. FrostBite!

South.description: You see the trail to Ickle.

rooms.name: Trail to Mt. FrostBite
rooms.description: You are standing on the trail to Mt. Frostbite.  The trail continues on to the north and south.

North.description: You see the trail to Mt. FrostBite!

South.description: You see the trail to Ickle.

rooms.name: Trail to Mt. FrostBite
rooms.description: You are standing on the trail to Mt. Frostbite.  A massive building stands to the east.  The trail continues on to the south and west.

South.description: You see the trail to Ickle.

West.description: You see the trail to Mt. FrostBite!

rooms.name: Trail to Mt. FrostBite
rooms.description: You are standing on the trail to Mt. Frostbite.  The trail continues on to the north and east.

North.description: You see the trail to Mt. FrostBite!

East.description: You see the trail to Ickle.

rooms.name: Under Mt. FrostBite
rooms.description: You are standing at the end of a trail.  Mt. Frostbite looms above you here.  You can either follow the trail south, back to Ickle, or you can climb the mountain and enter Mt.  FrostBite.

South.description: You see the trail to Ickle.

Up.description: You see Mt. FrostBite looming above you!

rooms.name: Outside Mt. FrostBite
rooms.description: You are standing in front of Mt. Frostbite!  There is a cave opening just north of here that will allow you to enter the ominous mountain itself.  Your only other choice would be to climb down and return to the trail below. Perhaps leaving here would be a GOOD idea!

North.description: You see the Entrance to Mt. FrostBite!

Down.description: You see the trail to Ickle.

rooms.name: Entrance to Mt. FrostBite
rooms.description: You are standing in the Entrance to Mt. Frostbite!  You can flee from this ominous mountain to the south, or you can delve deeper still to the north and west.

North.description: You see the Inside of Mt. FrostBite!

South.description: You see the Outside of Mt. FrostBite!

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: You are standing in a rough-hewn tunnel carved into Mt. Frostbite.  It is freezing cold in here.  Wind howls quickly through this tunnel.  The tunnel continues on to the west or you can return to the entrance to the east.

East.description: You see the Entrance to Mt. FrostBite!

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: You are standing in a rough-hewn tunnel carved into Mt. Frostbite.  It is freezing cold in here.  Wind howls quickly through this tunnel.  The tunnel continues on to the north and east from here.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: You are standing in a rough-hewn tunnel carved into Mt. Frostbite.  It is freezing cold in here.  Wind howls quickly through this tunnel.  The tunnel continues on to the north and south from here.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: You are standing in a rough-hewn tunnel carved into Mt. Frostbite.  It is freezing cold in here.  Wind howls quickly through this tunnel.  The tunnel continues on to the south from here.  You can also climb down to some lower tunnels from here.  The wind seems to be coming from the depths.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: You are standing in a rough-hewn tunnel carved into Mt. Frostbite.  It is freezing cold in here.  Wind howls quickly through this tunnel.  The tunnel continues on to the west from here or you could climb up to a higher set of tunnels above you.  The wind seems to be coming from the west.

rooms.name: Ice Tunnel
rooms.description: You are standing in a rough-hewn tunnel carved into Mt. Frostbite.  It is freezing cold in here.  Wind howls quickly through this tunnel.  The tunnel continues on to the east from here.  The tunnel opens up slightly into a small gorge to the north.  The wind seems to be coming from the gorge.

rooms.name: Ice Gorge
rooms.description: You are standing in a small gorge between two sections of rough-hewn tunnel carved into Mt. Frostbite.  You can feel the chilling arctic winds whipping into the tunnel from somewhere above.  The howling is quite loud and rather strange sounding.  The tunnel continues on to the south and west from here.

rooms.name: Inside of Mt. FrostBite
rooms.description: You are standing in a tunnel inside of Mt. Frostbite.  The tunnel continues on to the east and south of here.

East.description: You see a tunnel heading deeper into Mt. FrostBite.

South.description: You see the Entrance to Mt. FrostBite!

rooms.name: Inside of Mt. FrostBite
rooms.description: You are standing in a tunnel inside of Mt. Frostbite.  The tunnel continues on to the north and west of here.

North.description: You see a tunnel heading deeper into Mt. FrostBite.

West.description: You see a tunnel leading away from the depths of Mt. FrostBite.

rooms.name: Inside of Mt. FrostBite
rooms.description: You are standing in a tunnel inside of Mt. Frostbite.  The tunnel continues on to the north and south of here.

North.description: You see a tunnel heading deeper into Mt. FrostBite.

South.description: You see a tunnel leading away from the depths of Mt. FrostBite.

rooms.name: Inside of Mt. FrostBite
rooms.description: You are standing in a tunnel inside of Mt. Frostbite.  The tunnel continues on to the north and south of here.

North.description: You see a tunnel heading deeper into Mt. FrostBite.

South.description: You see a tunnel leading away from the depths of Mt. FrostBite.

rooms.name: Inside of Mt. FrostBite
rooms.description: You are standing in a tunnel inside of Mt. Frostbite.  The tunnel continues on to the south from here.  There is also an opening leading down to the very bowels of Mount FrostBite.  Dare you even consider it?!

South.description: You see a tunnel leading away from the depths of Mt. FrostBite.

Down.description: You see the Entrance to the Bowels of Mt. FrostBite.

rooms.name: Entrance to the Bowels of Mt. FrostBite
rooms.description: You are standing at the Entrance to the Bowels of Mt. Frostbite.  Your way to the west seems to be blocked at this time.  However, you can go to the east towards what appears to be a way out of here.  You can also climb up to another tunnel that lies just above this one.

East.description: You see a well lit tunnel leading out of Mt. FrostBite.

Up.description: You see the Inside of Mt. FrostBite.

rooms.name: A Well Lit Tunnel
rooms.description: You are standing in a well lit tunnel running east and west.  To the west is the Entrance to the Bowels of Mt. Frostbite.  Probably not a very good idea to go that way.  To the east the tunnel ends at a wall of ice.  Looks like you might not get very far in that direction.

East.description: You see the tunnel end at a wall of ice.

West.description: You see the Entrance to the Bowels of Mt. FrostBite.

rooms.name: A crevice in the ice
rooms.description: You are standing next to a wall of ice.  There is a crevice in the wall of ice that you should be able to fit through.  It looks like it might lead outside.  You can try to squeeze through the crevice to the east or you can head down the well lit tunnel to the west.

East.description: You see a crevice in the wall of ice.

West.description: You see a well lit tunnel.

rooms.name: An Icy Climb
rooms.description: Handholds cut into a wall of ice lead up here, and a narrow tunnel begins to the east.  Although not easy to access, this tunnel shows signs of fairly frequent traffic.  The floor is covered in crushed gravel so footing is easier than it would otherwise be.

Up.description: It looks like you can squeeze through the ice here.

rooms.name: Inside Mount Frostbite
rooms.description: Opening up into a small cavern, this tunnel leads both east and west from here.  West, it narrows down significantly, but it keeps its width to the east. The cavern looks mostly natural, but with some signs of human or other intervention - there are some smoothly polished portions of the walls and a large arrow pointing to the east with the word "Technitzitlan" written below it.

rooms.name: Inside Mount Frostbite
rooms.description: The path slopes sharply downwards here and opens up again to the west. There is only a slight breeze, suggesting that this tunnel is pretty far away from the mountain's surface.  Footprints in the crushed gravel floor hint at a fair amount of traffic in the area.

rooms.name: An Icy Climb Near Technitzitlan
rooms.description: This tunnel is rather broad, sloping sharply upwards and then leading off to the east.  Judging by the footprints in the crushed gravel floor, there is a decent amount of foot traffic in this area.  A few crude representations of animals and other symbols are on the walls, suggesting that it is people rather than monsters who made this path.

extras.text: There is a large cat here, carved into the ice on the northern wall.  On the ceiling are some smaller symbols, including a tiny triangle surrounded by spheres and the the inscription "Kourrya 2008".

rooms.name: An Icy Climb Near Technitzitlan
rooms.description: A spiral staircase begins winding its way down into darkness here, carved directly into the rock and ice of the mountain.  The broad tunnel leads to the west, its floor thoughtfully covered in crushed gravel to make footing easier. The staircase looks much narrower than the tunnel.

rooms.name: A Steep Climb
rooms.description: Leading upwards and downwards, this spiral staircase has been cut into the mountain for some unknown purpose.  Lacking any handholds and having very steep, narrow steps, it is not exactly the most comfortale or easy-to-traverse staircase.  It does appear small enough to keep out some of the larger creatures that inhabit the mountain, but it also prevents more than a few people from being on the stairs at a time.

rooms.name: A Steep Climb
rooms.description: Cut into the rock and ice of the tunnel, this spiral staircase has very high steps which are uncomfortably far-apart for a normal-sized human.  There are no handholds either, which does not make climing any easier.  Cut into the ice on the walls are some crude graffiti of beasts and other symbols.  The stairway leads up and down.

extras.text: Cut into the ice is a large picture of a feline with rather ferocious-looking fangs, surrounded by other symbols like a lightning bolt, a sun, a snowflake, and other weather-related pictograms.

rooms.name: An Ice Wall
rooms.description: The staircase comes to an end here, spilling out into a tunnel that continues on to the east.  Protected from the winds, it is still very chilly in here and there are patches of ice on every surface.  Gravel worn into the ice on the floor attests to a moderate amount of traffic, though whether from men or beasts is unclear.

rooms.name: Inside Mount Frostbite
rooms.description: It is dark and cold here inside the mountain.  Signs of moderate traffic mark the floors of this tunnel, as if this pathway is used regularly. Slippery-looking stairs have been cut into the rock and ice leading down, and they are covered with gravel to help keep the ice at bay.  The tunnel also leads back to the west, sloping gently upwards.

rooms.name: A Gravel Path
rooms.description: This pathway is lined with crushed gravel to make footing easier over the snow and ice even inside Mount Frostbite.  To the east, there appears to be a large open spaceand many people, perhaps the destination of this path.  Stairs cut into rock and ice lead upwards back to the mountain.

rooms.name: A Gravel Path Outside Technitzitlan
rooms.description: This narrow pathway leads away from the main courtyard of Technitzitlan, which is visible past some ice to the east, and back towards the inside of Mount Frostbite.  Narrow enough so that only a few people can walk abreast, the path is covered in crushed gravel to provide better footing.  The path continues to the west and the courtyard of Technitzitlan is to the east.

East.description: There is a crack in the ice here.

rooms.name: The Entrance to the Great Lodge
rooms.description: You stand before the massive double doors of some enormous lodge.  Each door stands nearly 10 feet tall and looks as old as Mt.  Frostbite itself.  The lodge towers easily 40 feet or more into the sky.  It is made from enormous timbers the likes of which have not been seen near Ickle in centuries, if ever. It must have taken an army of giants to erect such a building!  Boisterous chants or songs ring out among the sound of dozens of raucous voices.  It sounds like quite a party!

rooms.name: The Great Lodge
rooms.description: The Great Lodge is home to the oldest sect of the primal warriors, berserkers whose traditions date back to the beginning of the northern barbarian tribes.  The colossal building stands as a testament to their resilience against the ravages of dragons, cold, and time.  The Lodge houses dozens of berserkers drinking and chanting, feasting and fighting at all hours of the day.
